data.title: Mass exodus in Kampala

data.text:
Am just an hour away before i leave this office.

The situation still remains unknown as Kenyans in Uganda have been leaving in masses since last week.

All the buses are fully booked.

For those driving.

The cars are full serviced and ready to crank the engines and speed off to the nearest border.

Those who have families here have already left leaving some men around to survey the situation as they have some time to sample while their mamas are away.

My Ugandans pals are also leaving to their villages too and my sources are sure that things might not go well.

The army is patrolling every street with police parked at various places just in case.

We shall stay home till we are sure the situation is calm and collected come next week.

Am also leaving tomorrow morning to be with Mrs Madova and my little princesses.

Wish us well Ktalkers

Asante buda.

I have been telling my friends this could be the worst not like the war they had back then.

I strongly believe M7 cannot allow that shit to go down but wacha tuingie home maze wasije wakasema eti tuliimba kazi zao.

M7 told Ugandans to be aggressive like Kenyans

Buda boss where am based they passed like three time in one line.
